text: José Carlos da Silva Júnior (16 June 1926 – 5 March 2021) was a Brazilian politician and businessman. He was a member of the Democratic Social Party. He was a Senator from 1996 to 1999 and Vice-Governor of the state of Paraíba from 1983 to 1986. Silva Júnior died from COVID-19 in São Paulo, São Paulo, on 5 March 2021, at the age of 94, during the COVID-19 pandemic in Brazil. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Politicians from Paraíba Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in São Paulo
title: José Carlos da Silva Júnior
